headline: Fresh Pear Cake
description: This is the recipe that I like to use with the fresh pears that I get from my trees in late August. It's also lower in fat and cholesterol than most regular cakes.
name: Fresh Pear Cake
recipeIngredient: 4 cups peeled, cored and chopped pears

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the pears and the sugar and let stand for one hour.
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Spray a 10 inch bundt pan with non-stick cooking spray.
Slightly beat the egg whites and combine them with the oil, chopped pecans and pear mixture.
Stir the flour, salt, baking soda, nutmeg, cinnamon and cloves. Stir in the pear mixture. Pour batter into the prepared bundt pan.
Bake at 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) for 1 hour and 10 minutes. Remove from oven ant let cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes before removing form pan.

review.reviewBody: Great way to use up pears if you get a box of them for Christmas! Lovely moist cake (I used 2 whole eggs instead of 4 egg whites) and it was delicious!

Great recipe to use up pears that I have modified a bit after making it at least 30 times. I use 2 eggs instead of egg whites. Triple the spices. Add a tablespoon of vanilla. This has taken it to a 5 star recipe for me. My kids and co-workers love this one!
This cake was absolutely delicious. We have a pear tree and I wanted to use up my pears…I will definitely make this cake every year. Frosted the cake with just a glaze. Yummy!
This is an excellent cake recipe! The only modifications I make are adding a little less sugar (when the pears are ripe they are plenty sweet enough) and a lot more nuts! Great cake for fall!

First time I made a cake with pears and this recipe looked good as did the comments. The only thing I changed was I used about 2 tsp. Penzey's Pie Spice instead of separate spices listed as I find it is a good blend of cloves, cinnamon, star anise, ginger and vanilla. I also added the pie spice with the sugar as one comment mentioned so it blended. WIll definitely make this again!

Delicious cake! I replaced a third of the oil with butter as I like buttery taste. Also used ginger instead of nutmeg and cream cheese instead of eggs. It took a bit longer to bake and cool to be ready due to a lot of moisture, and a turned out to be a bit dense like a loaf, but yummy!

This was great! A fantastic way to use up pears that were just starting to go brown. I made it in two loaf pans so I could share it. It just kept getting more moist each day, and lasted several days very well.

Scrap the nutmeg and substitute ginger in the same amount. Also, the pears make the dough VERY wet, so you may need to extend the cook time if you're even a smidge over the 3 cups of pears they recommend. Might not be a bad idea to soak up some of the pear juice with paper towels before mixing with the sugar actually. But the flavor and texture is fabulous. Walnuts worked nicely in place of pecans.

So delicious! Personally I found it a bit too sweet, and next time will omit some sugar. I cut my pear pieces to approximately half inch chunks, and next time I will make them smaller. Also note that the batter is VERY thick, and you can't quite "pour" it as mentioned in the recipe. Don't worry- it still bakes wonderfully!
Delicious, moist, cooks beautifully, a total winner!

I used apple sauce and Greek yogurt instead of oil. 2 eggs. Walnuts instead of pecans. 4 big pears. Added ginger to the spices. Half whole wheat and half AP flour. Cut back sugar to 1.5 cups (raw sugar). Added spices and black rum to the pear mixture for about 30 mins. Had enough for 6 big muffins and a very small loaf. Only baked for 40 mins or so. Made confectioner sugar, milk, vanilla and black rum drizzle. Delicious but will add more spices next time. Great holiday treat!

This is incredible! I halved the recipe and grated a couple tablespoons fresh ginger into the sugar/pear mixture. I chopped the pears up pretty tiny and probably used a bit more than the recipe said just because that’s what I had- the recipe was pretty forgiving tho and the bread turned out delicious and moist with an incredible ginger pear flavor. I also used one whole egg instead of two egg whites and that seemed to work just fine. Definitely something I’ll be making again! I might use 2/3 cup sugar instead of the full cup next time but I generally prefer things a little less sweet.
this cake was amazing. the only thing I did differently was use ginger instead of nutmeg (grabbed it first). yum!
This is an overall okay cake. It is a bit too sweet though that is easily adjustable. This cake is nice and moist. and I had to shave off the edges for they were doughy.

I made these and I used suggestions from reviews on halving the spices except the cinnamon as well as I used two whole eggs instead of four whites. It came out delicious! I will definitely make again! I also used mini Bundt cake pans to make individual cakes.
Perfect every time!
I have been making this cake for about a year now and it’s a family favorite. I have made it with pears but I also like to use this recipe when I have old apples. Great for breakfast

I loved this! I hate when people don’t try the original recipe the first time....but I grated in about a teaspoon of fresh ginger, and I added my newest obsession-cardamom. I also used chopped walnuts because it was all I had. It was fantastic!
Wonderful! I didn’t have quite enough pears so I added an apple.

This Pear cake is nice but the clove over powers the pear flavor. I will make it again but will not include the clove.

This is a thick heavy cake, reminds me more of banana bread.
I made this the first time we had fresh pears and took it to a Christmas party still warm I came back the two pieces it is amazing easy to make for flavor and moist

I am one of those terrible people who reviews a recipe after changing it from the original. But hear me out! The changes I made are not ones that would affect the chemical composition of the batter or anything.
I made it for my kids who don’t like nuts, so I left out the pecans, and subbed vanilla (1tsp) and almond (1/2 tsp) extracts for all the spices. I also didn’t have vegetable oil in the house so I used melted butter for the fat. The finished cake is so beautiful and delicious.
The best cake! Moist and delicious. I have a pear tree and needed to use up some of the excess fruit.

I made it exactly according to the recipe. After baking at 325 for 1h10m, and letting it sit for 10m, I flipped it out of the bundt pan and... it was raw in the middle! I put it back in the pan, turned the oven up to 350, and baked it for another 35 minutes. At that point, it was bedtime and I left it on the stove top until the AM. I decided not to try turning it out of the pan at this point, but the end product WAS quite tasty, if not exactly pretty :)

OMG - this cake was “delicious”! So easy to make. Perfect “Breakfast cake”!
Or for dessert. I would like to know if anyone added a liquor/rum for the holidays
I make this cake over & over again with pears from my old tree. Everyone loves it and I have to guard that tree!
It was fantastic. I used a doughnut mold to make several and it made a great grab and run. They did not last. Lol
I used 1.5 cups sugar and it was too sweet. Next time I’ll use 1 cup of sugar. Also, it took longer to bake.

I followed the advice of several reviews and cut the spices in half, except for the cinnamon. My pears were very sweet so I used only one cup of sugar. I baked it it an angel food cake pan and found that an hour was about 5 minutes too long. It was very good. Next time I’ll chop up the pears smaller.
So easy! So tasty! So moist! I added half cup of raisins to this already moist batter! The family all enjoyed it!
excellent. Cut the sugar in 1/2, but otherwise stayed to the recipe. Will make it again,
Excellent recipe. I used eggbeater instead of the whole eggs and did them as muffins instead of a cake. It was a big hit, I’ll be making it again. Thanks!

I made 1/2 the recipe--& baked in a loaf pan--substituted walnuts/for pecans & applesauce/for oil & cut sugar by a 1/3. Also-did not use clove-used a little ginger instead w/cinnamon & nutmeg. Was delicious & more Bread like- than cake. Baked for 55mins.
Amazing and a great way to use an over-abundance of pears!
Easy to make!
A great way to use pears that might be a little past their prime! Easy, delicious cake, very moist.

I will definitely make it again! I used 5 pears and cut back a little on the sugar. Used chunky applesauce in place of oil, had to use 2 loaf pans because I couldn't find my bundt pan but other than that kept it the same as the recipe stated. It was amazing!!
Great birthday cake. Moist .(Will not chop pecans too fine next time.) Served with thinly sliced, overlapping fresh pears ar the bottom of cake.
I followed recipe as given except baked in 9x13 and used 3 whole eggs. Moist and spices just right. I will bake less time, next time, and try walnuts instead.

I've been making this every Fall for the past three years and it's always perfect. I don't alter anything except I'll use coconut oil if that's all I've got on hand. Definitely one of my favorite recipes.

Believe the hype! This recipe is terrific. I used all the most common modifications suggested: I used whole eggs instead of whites and a teaspoon of ginger (which I prefer to nutmeg - but I did add a dash of nutmeg). I also soaked the pears 1 T of dark rum and a tsp of vanilla along with the sugar. I did not add nuts, however, since I was using it for mini bundt cakes. The recipe was exceptional in the bundt cakelet pan. In fact, I used three other recipes from the brand website and this was the only one that worked in all of the cakelet shapes. I was surprised because I thought the pears would throw off the shapes, but they looked great! Lastly, I did use a combination of Bosc pears and Asian, all peeled, and cut no larger than 1/2" pieces. The Asian pears remained a teeny bit firm compared to the others, which gives the cakelets a fantastic texture.
Was ok. The pear flavor got lost.
I added to my favorites. I added 1/2 cup of craisins and used walnuts instead of pecans. Used a silicone bundt pan and cooked an additional 30 min. Was delicious!!

Awesome recipe. I switched out ginger for the cloves as I didn't have ground cloves. Excellent use for the egg whites I had left over from making gelato and the fact that it's fall and I have a million pears. Great flavor and texture.

I fixed a couple of foibles in the recipe and the end result was quite tasty. Specifically I made it with 100% whole wheat flour and included 4 whole eggs, not just the whites. I really like the balance of the spices and the texture of the pear and pecans adds interest to the spice cake. I didn't have a bundt pan so I just made it in a normal square pan which worked out fine.
I was so delicious and moist. I shared it with my Mom and sister. They were both impressed. It will be a great addition to the Thanksgiving table this year.

Made this today with fresh pears from our tree, DELICIOUS and so easy to prepare. I left out the cloves, and added 1 teaspoon of fresh minced ginger to the wet mixture. Otherwise, I followed the recipe to a T. Baked perfectly, came right out of bundt pan perfectly. Wonderful, most cake.

Made 2 batches, then 2 more the next day with the bumper crop of pears. Added extra pear for average of 1.5 lbs of chopped per per batch. BF really likes the surprise bites of pear chunks. Since I'm not crazy about "spice" cakes, I skipped the clove and I cut back on nutmeg. Used 1/2t ginger, and 1/2 t nutmeg. This is a keeper!
For an extra attractive cake, I made a vanilla glaze. Received 3 unsolicited compliments for the tasty cake at a large family reunion.
July 2019 update: Made recipe 6 times. One recipe can make (6) mini loaf pans or (2) regular loaf. Just adjust the bake time.
Great recipe - I cut back by half on the spices also. I will be making the again.
It was so moist and sooooo good
Great recipe. Very easy and taste great. One of my friends suggested a simple sauce with lemon juice and confectioners sugar.

I used pears I received for Christmas & it came out super! It's like a spice cake with pears & pecans. I was able to get some fresh pecans from a local grower which helped make it great! I plan to make another one for New Year's Eve!

This is a fabulous recipe. Everyone loved it. I cut the sugar back to 1 1/4 cups and it was still sweet enough. I'll be making this again. I heated a little cream cheese frosting (from a can) and drizzled it over the cake.
I made this for a church pot luck last week. It was so fabulous, I am making it again for a friend’s birthday! I did cut back the sugar to 1 1/2 cups, and it was sweet and moist and full of flavor!

I had 5 pears and it was enough. I used slightly more than half of the spices and it wasn't too much, as i didn't want spice cake either. This is an excellent recipe! I will make again and use a glaze icing next time.
This was a hit a my house. I didn't have ground cloves at home so I substituted it with ground ginger, I also used less sugar 1 1/2 cups and bake it for 90 min at 325 conv. bake. Easy cake recipe

This was outstanding with the changes I made. I used two whole eggs and melted butter instead of egg whites and canola oil. I reduced the sugar to 1 1/2 cups. I used 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, 1 heaping teaspoon nutmeg, and 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg. (Without nutmeg and with all the cinnamon, it will taste like apple cake, not pear cake.)

It was delicious and my whole family loved it.
very nice mild cake, I did it in 2 loaf pans for easier sharing. gave a loaf to my mom and a loaf to my dad.
If I make this cake again I will add only the cinnamon. The spices are overwhelming. I would also use 1 cup of oil instead of 2/3.

I didn't have nutmeg, so I used allspice. Apparently, didn't matter because this cake was outstanding. Crispy outside, moist inside - the perfect marriage. My family and friends behaved as though it were the final dessert before world's end! Oh, I topped it with cream cheese frosting.

Delicious! I made this and took it to a potluck and everyone raved about it. 
I started making this at night and realized I didn't have the ingredients. I had already put the pears and sugar together so I put them in the fridge overnight. I finished the recipe the next day and it the pause didn't seem to make much difference.

After reading many reviews, I adjusted the recipe by reducing the sugar to 1 1/2 cups, omitted the nutmeg and cloves but added 1/2 tsp ginger, used two whole eggs instead of egg whites, and added 1 tbsp rum, 1 tbsp lemon juice, and 1 tsp vanilla to apples while they were soaking. I made a rum glaze and drizzled it over the cake after it cooled slightly - OMGoodness! This has become my all-time favorite cake! I think it's a very forgiving recipe, and many changes can be made to fit your preferences. I had a bumper crop of pears this year, so I'll be in the process of freezing a whole bunch of pears so that I can make this cake all winter long!

I made this cake yesterday. It is very good. I substituted Splenda sugar blend at the proper ratio and used one cup of coconut flower to replace 1 of the cups of flour. My husband is diabetic and the substitutions make the recipe slightlyl less carbs for him. He can have a little peice every now and then if he leaves off a bread or starch at his meal. He love it by the way. 
Family visiting our farm today loved it also. I am freezing some of the rest of the cake and I am sure it will freeze well. It is very close to the same recipe I use with apples.
I will make this cake again
This was a pretty good cake but I found it dense. I used fresh pears but the taste of the pears was subtle rather than as strong as I was expecting.

I made this and it had such great texture and taste! Perfect combination of spices. I substituted coconut oil instead of canola oil with no real affect. I also made an icing drizzle using 1 cup of confectioners sugar, 1 tsp vanilla, and 2 T triple sec (instead of water or milk) and it worked great with this!

I turned this recipe into muffins and they are amazing! Using the extra large muffin tins I baked at 350 for 45 minutes. It will make XL 10 muffins. I also sprinkled a few walnuts on top with a bit of cinnamon sugar. They muffins are so moist and look like they came from a bakery. This is a definite keeper recipe for me.

Wonderful cake and loved by everyone! I cut down on the spices since I don’t especially care for the clovey cinnamon kind of spices and upped the vanilla. This is the type of cake that you keep in regular rotation while you can get Some good pears!

The cake was absolutely delicious. I did not have any nutmeg nor ginger, so put only cinnamon for spices, and it still turned out very good. Also, as suggested by other bakers, put only one cup of sugar and that was perfect for our liking.
A very moist cake which was easy to make. I iced it, as it seemed a bit too plain without a topping. It is similar in texture and taste to carrot cake.

This was an excellent recipe! I did cut the sugar in half, using brown sugar because that's all I had. I may have added 5 cups of pears, not exactly sure because I just eye balled it ??. Soooo good! Will definitely make this cake again!
Cut the recipe in 1/2, put it into a loaf pan and added a crumb topping.

This is a great recipe. Next time I might use less ground cloves.
Some family members thought it was too strong, but otherwise
delicious! It was a new spice container, that might have been it
also!
Baking time was on point and it was crispy on the outside and moist inside. I will certainly make this again.
Fantastic!!!! I added 1/2 teaspoon of nutmeg - cinnamon and cloves - just for a kick!!! I will be making this again for sure!!!

This is a seriously delicious cake! Got lots of wonderful Harry and David pears for Christmas and couldn't eat them all, but didn't want them to go to waste. Found this recipe and the reviews convinced me to try it. So glad I did. After reading the other reviews, I substituted ginger for the cloves. I also left out the nuts because I don't like nuts in my cakes. The other thing I did was used half the oil and then used apple sauce for the other half. I do this with most of my baking to cut down on the calories. It came out perfect! It took exactly an hour and 10 minutes, and it was moist and flavorful. A huge hit! I will definitely be making this again!

I had to stop eating processed sugar and this is the first real cake I have managed to make for myself in years! I substituted coconut palm sugar for the other sugars and turned out spectacularly. Like the others, mine baked perfectly in an hour.
This is delicious! I'll make it again and I recommend it. The only change I made was I put in 1/2 tsp nutmeg and cloves but the full tsp of cinnamon. Just a personal preference.

Very good cake. I read all the reviews and decided to cut the nutmeg and clove in half, and I'm glad I did. I didn't want to make a spice cake, I wanted to make a fresh pear cake. I did soak the pears in sugar for the full hour and I think that is the way to go. Everything remained the same. This cake is very moist and super delicious. I will make this again.
Very moist and flavorful. Of all the recipes that I have tried, this is my favorite way to use extra pears!

Made this with extra pears and it was fantastic. Big hit with the family and more flavorful than I expected. The only variation I did was not to peel the pears. The skins get very soft when baking and it adds more flavor. Made it in a cut bundt pan and it turned out beautiful.

Very yummy. Following advice of others, cut sugar in half for personal preference (and used half brown, half white), and the whole egg. Half the recipe made 12 cupcakes (baked for 18 minutes). Topped w cream cheese frosting (but loved it without frosting, too).

great flavor and loved the spice combination with the pears. I modified a bit by substituting apple sauce for the oil and used the entire egg instead of just egg whites and skipped the pecans. Definitely will make again. will try pecans in the next batch. Yummy!

I made no changes because I like to make recipe as directed the first time so I will know how to adapt the flavors for us. I used Harry & David Royal Riviera pears because i had them and needed to use them up. Before prepping I had read many of the reviews to get a sense of the ease of preparing and the balance of flavors. I had read I believe it was several reviews that referred
to it as "spice cake". I have to say I didn't find it all overbearing in the combination of spices; in fact. I will increase the cinnamon and add nutmeg next time I make it. I will continue to make it as it is a delightfully moist cake.

Modified as follows: no oil, but unsweetened applesauce, two eggs, 1.25 c sugar, 1/4 t cloves (would use even less next time), dozen grinds of fresh nutmeg, and no nuts. Changes brought down the calories to 241 for 1/12 of a piece. Very nice, moist cake. Would make again. Used ripe pears off the tree. Also made in a spring form pan, instead of a bundt pan. Cooked about the same time.

This cake turned out moist and flavorful. I took a few liberties with the original recipe such as reducing the sugar to 1 1/2 cups (maybe reduce it more, depending on the pears), decreasing the amount of nutmeg, and adding 1/2 tsp. ground ginger. The pears I used were ripe and large (3 pears = 4 cups). I baked it for 60 minutes and it was perfect. This cake was served at a friend's house and everyone loved it. Great dessert for autumn!

Delicious!!!..my first ever ever cake from scratch. I made two!!!!!!! Took them both to celebrate mom's birthday and they were gone, any left overs were taken by the guest.. i did not use any ginger (didn't have any) and used 2whole eggs instead of 4 egg whites. I read a review where someone did this since they could never figure out what to do with the left over egg and so I did the same. I also sprayed the bundt pan and sprinkled brown sugar and cinnamon (again following other reviewers directions). The results were great..I will do it again. I took a piece home and put in ziplock bag placed in fridge and had it with coffe 6 days later. It was still super delicious. My daughter said we should always have this cake/bread in the house.
This cake was extremely sweet. I will look for another recipe that uses less sugar and less oil.
Amazing, that I'd cook it a little less than the stated time.
I have made this cake 14 times in the last two weeks. I followed the recipe exactly. No need to make any changes. It has been a big hit with family and co-workers
My family really liked this recipe. I used half whole-wheat flour, and substituted chopped walnuts for the pecans (as I didn't have any on hand). Very tasty!

I made 3 of these. I ran short of pears on the third one so I substituted some apples to go with the pears. I also ran short of nuts so I tossed in some almonds with my pecans. I baked for 1:05 and they were all perfect.

O.M.G.this cake is so delicious I didn't have any pears
so I used two diced apples and made a glaze for over the top.
Will make it again using pears.
Thanks Helene

I made this cake but am not a fan of nutmeg & cloves so I only added the cinnamon. You need to make sure you let the pears & sugar sit for an hour before adding them to the other ingredients or you will have problems with the cake being dry. I will make this again.
Added a little bourbon to the pears and sugar ... otherwise no other changes. Wonderfully moist! Would be great for breakfast or dessert.
I made it just as directed and it was fabulous
One of my co-workers at the office made this! Wow it is great.
This was moist and delicious! I used slightly less sugar and 2 whole eggs and one egg white. The batter is very wet, but when baked, it came out perfectly!
More spice cake than pear cake, but still tasty. I might try again with less spice more pear.
Delicious! I didn't have cloves in the house, so just used pumpkin pie spice for all except the cinnamon. Also, halved the sugar because the pears were so sweet. The cake is moist and delicious.
Thus was my first pear bread and it was delicious. Baked up nicely and tasted great. Would be awesome as brunch, coffee cake, or less sweet desert cake with a drop of real whip cram on it. Yummy!
